title.value: Non-minimal Lorentz invariance violation in light of muon anomalous magnetic moment and long-baseline neutrino oscillation data
title.justification: This is the title of the paper.
title.quote: Non-minimal Lorentz invariance violation in light of muon anomalous magnetic moment and long-baseline neutrino oscillation data

extractions.description: This research paper explores the potential of Lorentz invariance violation (LIV) as an explanation for recent anomalies observed in neutrino oscillation experiments, specifically focusing on data from the T2K and NOvA experiments. The authors investigate both isotropic and non-isotropic LIV effects in various dimensions (D=4, 5, 6) to assess their impact on neutrino oscillation parameters and their potential to reconcile tensions between experimental results. The study also examines the implications of LIV for the anomalous muon magnetic moment.

type.justification: The paper analyzes experimental data and explores theoretical implications.
type.quote: In this work, we study the prospects of uncovering LIV physics in neutrino oscillation experiments.
